newsitem.title: USA: Standard Federal may be acqquired - report.
newsitem.headline: Standard Federal may be acqquired - report.

text.p: Standard Federal Bank, a $15.5 billion asset Michigan-based bank holding company, is expected to be acquired by ABN AMRO Holding NV of the Netherlands, according to the November 22 issue of the Chicago Tribune.
Officials of Stanard Federal, based in Troy, Mich., were not immediately available to comment on the report.
The proposed multibillion dollar transaction is expected to be announced today, a Chicago Tribune report said.
Trading in Standard Federal Bank shares was halted yesterday pending an announcement.

Standard Federal, the holding company for Standard Federal Bank, which is a large home mortgage lender in Michigan and a large Midwest thrift. The company currently operates about 180 banking centers and 11 home lending centers. Standard Federal operates a wholesale mortgage banking business through its InterFirst division.
